name: GPT-Replit
description: A little ChatGPT in your Replit editor that can view your files (if you want).
longDescription:
# Replit-GPT
A little ChatGPT in your Replit editor. If you open a file with GPT-replit, the file contents will be passed to the AI so you can ask questions about it.

You can double click codeblocks to copy them, use your voice, use GPT-4 & 3.5 (if you have access) and more!

## Settings.gptreplit
The settings.gptreplit file is an optional configuration file for the Replit-GPT chatbot. It contains plain text key-value pairs.

Example:
```
temperature:0.8
model:gpt-4-0613
```

Settings
```
temperature: Controls randomness of GPT model (0.1-2.0). Default: 0.7.

model: GPT model to be used. Default: "gpt-3.5-turbo". Can also be set using the interface, but this allows you to use more modals than just "gpt-3.5-turbo", "gpt-4", "gpt-4-32k". For example you can say `gpt-4-0613` or `gpt-3.5-turbo-16k`. **Note:** It has to be an OpenAI chatmodel. Models like `text-davinci-003` won't work
```

scopes.name: read
scopes.reason: Reading the opened file to provide more information to GPT
